fields.description:
the menu item 'view review history' does not work unless you are on the review page in question - on any other page, nothing happens. the problem is most likely due to the call to {{AJS.CRU.REVIEW.HISTORY.showPage}} which assumes the {{permaId}} global exists, and that is only true on a review page.

The menu item should go to the review in question, and then pop up the history dialog box.

----
bq. [!http://img.skitch.com/20100303-q3hrtei7bd9m4jixrrisgu7whd.png|width=400!|http://img.skitch.com/20100303-q3hrtei7bd9m4jixrrisgu7whd.png]

fields.description:
1.  If the role of the current user has changed, then a *page refresh is required* as permissions will most likely have changed
2. If there is any data that needs to be retrieved from the server (eg new comments or frxs), there should be at most 1 remote call to fetch the information, rather than a request for each object type to retrieve.

fields.description:
see https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/FECRU/Review+polling+refactor+-+Requirements

Anna B. has implemented a lucene index with review participant added/removed events.

   1. The review tells the server it's last updated timestamp
   2. Server responds with an array of participant objects that have been added, and an array of participant ids that have been removed since that timestamp
          * This should be a check against the Lucene index, and not an HQL query
fields.summary: Crucible review polling refactor: Handle added/removed participants

fields.description:
According to gadget docs & tutes (see: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GADGETDEV/Internationalising+your+Gadget and http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GADGETDEV/Example+of+Gadget+XML+Specification ), the #supportedLocales("gadget.common") directive will include a common message bundle for a bunch of locales. This works for gadgets served from Jira, but not for those served from Crucible. This causes your config pages to look broken (see attached image - top is a cru gadget, bottom a jira one).
A workaround is available (hardcoding each gadget.common string in each gadget header) but that's annoying, esp. so for content which is be common accross multiple gadgets and is already provided by Jira.

This appears to be a symptom of CRUC-2501.
fields.summary: Gadgets served from crucible can't use gadget.common message bundle.

fields.description:
In plain Jersey (and fecru's vanilla hardwired Jersey configuration), clients can choose their content type using the {{Content-Type}} and {{Accept}} request headers.

This is painful when making requests from javascript using AJS, as you cannot add these custom request headers (see [AG-1244|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AG-1244]), so the other products have added a Jersey filter that looks for an extension to the request URL (.json, .xml, .atom, etc) and the filter will clip it off and add the required HTTP request header before delegating the request to Jersey.

We should do the same and add that filter [https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/REST/trunk/atlassian-rest-module/src/main/java/com/atlassian/plugins/rest/module/filter/ExtensionJerseyFilter.java?r=32514] to our web.xml in the same way we added {{FECRUResponseExpansionFilter}}.

Note that the filter is part of atlassian-rest-module, which we ship as a bundled plugin. We'll need to make it a proper maven dependency so we don't have to copy-paste the class.
fields.summary: Add ExtensionJerseyFilter from atlassian-rest-module to our Jersey config

fields.summary: Password recovery email link is broken

fields.description:
Currently committer mappings are only available via requesting a user profile. To get that user, the authenticated user needs to be an admin or the user in question.

Our API does not provide any facility for getting the user mapped to a committer, neither does it allow for a bulk request to get all mappings.

To establish committer mappings the following steps must be taken:

1. Get all users
2. For each user, impersonate that user and get their profile
3. Build up a data storage
4. Get your committer.

Which doesn't even account for those mappings changing.
fields.summary: Expose committer mappings in API

fields.description:
The evaluator experience from the 2.2.0 Setup page is confusing.  When one clicks either of the "generate evaluation license" links, the My Atlassian page opens and the user enters their org name, etc.  Then, the key is generated and the user finds himself on a page with a long, ugly license in a textarea input.  What is he supposed to do with it?  Since the intention is to have the user click in that space, copy the string, and return to the Setup page back on the FE server, we should help make that more usable.

1. Clicking on either "generate evaluation license" tab should open the MyAtlassian page in a new tab or window.
2. Once the license is generated, the Licenses page should have a way to indicate the next action.
2.a. If the Licenses page can't convey that information clearly, then the Setup page in FE should have some informative text explaining what the user _will_ do once the "generate license" link is clicked.
fields.summary: Should open "generate evaluation license" in new tab/window

fields.description: The setup screen provides the option to "Generate a  thirty day FishEye + Crucible evaluation license."  When that option is clicked, the option in the "product" dropdown only says "Crucible."  We should be consistent there and call it FishEye + Crucible (if that is, in fact, what the license is).  I know this is probably something that the web team needs to address, but not sure how to log it.
fields.summary: Need to rename eval license generation option

fields.description:
If you migrate between database the following message will not be shown/hidden until you restart: 

!http://img.skitch.com/20100222-geciq9rppkxwwikserddpd9rfb.jpg!

Also the warning icon doesn't fit properly.
fields.summary: The warning message about case sensitivity is not refreshed when migrating databases.

fields.description:
We've had several report of the "database is using case-insensitive comparisons for character fields" message being showing in Crucible 2.2 despite having the character collation set to utf8_bin as suggested in our documentation. 

* http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-2814
* http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257332883&tstart=0

I ripped out some of the check we are doing for case sensitivity and ran it against a database on my machine to report the CASE_SENSITIVE property of all fields: 

{noformat}[amyers@erdinger:~]$ java -cp Applications/fisheye/fecru-2.2.0/lib/dbdrivers/mysql/mysql-connector-java-5.1.10.jar:. Test  
Successfully connected to MySQL server using TCP/IP...
 Type Name: BIT Case Sensitive: true
 Type Name: BOOL Case Sensitive: true
 Type Name: TINYINT Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: TINYINT UNSIGNED Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: BIGINT Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: BIGINT UNSIGNED Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: LONG VARBINARY Case Sensitive: true
 Type Name: MEDIUMBLOB Case Sensitive: true
 Type Name: LONGBLOB Case Sensitive: true
 Type Name: BLOB Case Sensitive: true
 Type Name: TINYBLOB Case Sensitive: true
 Type Name: VARBINARY Case Sensitive: true
 Type Name: BINARY Case Sensitive: true
 Type Name: LONG VARCHAR Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: MEDIUMTEXT Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: LONGTEXT Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: TEXT Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: TINYTEXT Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: CHAR Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: NUMERIC Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: DECIMAL Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: INTEGER Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: INTEGER UNSIGNED Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: INT Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: INT UNSIGNED Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: MEDIUMINT Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: MEDIUMINT UNSIGNED Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: SMALLINT Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: SMALLINT UNSIGNED Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: FLOAT Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: DOUBLE Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: DOUBLE PRECISION Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: REAL Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: VARCHAR Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: ENUM Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: SET Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: DATE Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: TIME Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: DATETIME Case Sensitive: false
 Type Name: TIMESTAMP Case Sensitive: false

Your database is using case-insensitive comparisons for character fields.

[amyers@erdinger:~]$ mysql -e "show full columns from cru_stored_path" crucible 
+-------------+---------+-----------+------+-----+---------+-------+---------------------------------+---------+
| Field       | Type    | Collation | Null | Key | Default | Extra | Privileges                      | Comment |
+-------------+---------+-----------+------+-----+---------+-------+---------------------------------+---------+
| cru_path_id | int(11) | NULL      | NO   | PRI | NULL    |       | select,insert,update,references |         |
| cru_path    | text    | utf8_bin  | YES  | MUL | NULL    |       | select,insert,update,references |         |
+-------------+---------+-----------+------+-----+---------+-------+---------------------------------+---------+
{noformat}
fields.summary: Case Sensitivity check acting funny with MySQL using utf8_bin collation

fields.description: It is great to be able to review confluence content, but it is not very user-friendly since there is no option to view the page in rendered mode. I would think most of the time people are reviewing the actual content of the page (for example, a design document written as a wiki page instead of a word doc), not the wiki syntax. It makes it difficult to have to ask people to ignore all the markup, and thus less valuable.
fields.summary: Improve UI for reviewing confluence pages

fields.description:
ive connected to the repo/path https://studio.sydney.atlassian.com/svn/FE/trunk/src/java/com/cenqua/crucible/model/managers/impl

DefaultProjectManager.java was merged from a different branch (not known to this fe repo), and the linecount goes screwy. 

the revision 7713 should have +7-7 lines, instead it says +130.

i think it has something to do with the first revision knowing about it's ancestor, and saying that it has 260 lines. look at DiffChangeSetProcessor.java line 983

        at com.atlassian.crucible.activity.review.CoalescingActivityItemProviderBase.findActivityItemsAndCoalesce(CoalescingActivityItemProviderBase.java:27)
        at com.atlassian.crucible.activity.review.LuceneReviewStateChangeActivityItemProvider.findActivityItems(LuceneReviewStateChangeActivityItemProvider.java:54)
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.activity.DefaultActivityItemManager.findActivityItems(DefaultActivityItemManager.java:49)
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.activity.ActivityStreamHandler.handleActivityStream(ActivityStreamHandler.java:151)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.ChangelogServlet.doViewDir(ChangelogServlet.java:278)

We should purge deleted reviews from the index, but to avoid the NPE I added a defensive check (https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/changelog/FE/?cs=55336)
fields.summary: NPE thrown by deleted reviews in activity items

fields.description: I am looking into changing the Crucible notification email templates to include the FishEye project that the Crucible review is associated with and with the current documentation, I am not given the full list of available Crucible notification freemarkder data model components available.  This page is available in FishEye (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Freemarker+Data+Model+for+Email+Templates) but an accompanying page for Crucible does not contain all the Objects (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Freemarker+Data+Model+for+Email+Templates).  The FishEye page appears to be much more complete and useful than the Crucible one.
fields.summary: Crucible Freemarker Data Model Documentation

fields.description:
This {noformat}{{ i += 1}}{noformat} is rendered incorrectly. The '{{+}}' is interpreted as the underline meta symbol inside the monospace '\{\{\}\}' meta symbol. Meta symbols inside the monospace symbol should not be interpreted but outputed verbatim.

Also, escaping like this {noformat}{{ i \+= 1}}{noformat} does not work either - produces wrongly html encoded output.

screenshots :
|| [!http://img.skitch.com/20100215-fmye9mcis37dwrqpyudpd9mb5p.jpg|width=600! |http://img.skitch.com/20100215-fmye9mcis37dwrqpyudpd9mb5p.jpg] ||
----
|| [!http://img.skitch.com/20100215-rq4ejgphyqasditrsup6b7s19d.jpg|width=600! | http://img.skitch.com/20100215-rq4ejgphyqasditrsup6b7s19d.jpg] ||
fields.summary: the character '+' is not correctly rendered in wiki text inside monospace symbol

fields.description: I would like to see the ability to remove backups after a set time period.  With the scheduling of backups via the admin console, we still need to manually remove older, stale backups.
fields.summary: Remove Backups Older than X
Optimize rendering of side-by-side segments
Deleted unused CSS from crucible.css .container-tabbed and .row-change
Deleted unused CSS from #state-due, #time-spent and #submit-time IDs
Deleted unused css from .review_state and #footer IDs

fields.description: When fetching more lines from the server the side-by-side diff currently just displays a blank pane until the new data is in.
fields.summary: Add loading spinners to side-by-side diff

fields.description:
Attemp to make Rescan revisions from specific (non zero) revision results to:

{quote}
Your request was unable to be processed
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
startRevision must be positive, instead is 0.
{quote}

So I can't change "Symbolic Rules" of repository and can't make its reindex.
fields.summary: Can't start repository rescan from specific revision

fields.description:
this is related to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/IDESP-34


Customer uses LightSVN plugin.
Getting repositories API (if FishEye configured) : http://localhost:8060/rest-service/repositories-v1
returns repository description:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<repositories>
  <repoData xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:type="svnRepositoryData">
    <enabled>true</enabled>
    <name>Local</name>
    <type>svn</type>
    <path />
    <url>https://127.0.0.1/svn/dummy1</url>
  </repoData>
</repositories>

But using LightSVN returns:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<repositories>
  <repoData xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:type="pluginRepositoryData">
    <enabled>true</enabled>
    <name>StudioPL</name>
    <type>plugin</type>
    <available>true</available>
    <description>StudioPL @ https://studio.atlassian.com/svn/PL/ - Subversion</description>
    <hasChangelogBrowser>true</hasChangelogBrowser>
    <hasDirectoryBrowser>true</hasDirectoryBrowser>
    <pluginKey>com.atlassian.crucible.plugins.crucible-svn-scm-plugin:scmprovider</pluginKey>
    <stateDescription>running</stateDescription>
  </repoData>
</repositories>

DIFFERENCE is in REPOSITORY <type>
Please change LighSVN repository to type SVN
fields.summary: Different repository types for FishEye and LightSVN plugin (both should be SVN)
